turns.content: what are the chances of running two kickoff returns in the same NFL game

It is relatively rare for a team to have two kickoff returns in the same NFL game, as most kickoffs result in the receiving team taking possession of the ball and starting a drive from their own 20-yard line. However, it is possible for a team to score a touchdown on a kickoff return and then have the opportunity to return another kickoff later in the game. The chances of this happening depend on a variety of factors, including the strength of the two teams, the playing style of the teams, and the specific players involved. In general, it is more likely to see two kickoff returns in a game between two weaker teams or in a game where one team is significantly favored over the other and is able to dominate play.

However, it has happened a few times in NFL history. According to my research, there have been at least four instances of a team scoring two touchdowns on kickoff returns in the same game:

* On November 6, 1949, the Chicago Bears returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Green Bay Packers.
* On September 21, 1952, the Los Angeles Rams returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Chicago Cardinals.
* On November 14, 1971, the Kansas City Chiefs returned two kickoffs for touchdowns against the Denver Broncos.

It's worth noting that these instances are relatively rare, and it is much more common for a team to score a touchdown on a kickoff return once or twice in a season rather than in the same game.
